definition: window/the opening panel of a window
fan/sliding, hinged or detachable flat part of sth/classifier for doors, windows etc
to fan/to slap sb on the face

sentences.english: When the window frame is closed , its joint will be tight and resistant to sound and heat.
sentences.chinese: 窗扇關閉時，接縫嚴密，具有良好的隔音，隔熱效果。

sentences.english: Look up and see the casement broken in.
sentences.chinese: 請擡頭上望，窗扇已被闖破了臉。

sentences.english: As you look towards the top of the windows the circle is revealed.
sentences.chinese: 當你向上觀望，會看見圓環被繪畫在頂部的兩頁窗扇。

sentences.english: The sash is angled to provide a more comfortable operating position than a vertical sash.
sentences.chinese: 傾斜的窗扇提供一個比垂直窗框更舒適的操作位置。

sentences.english: High – grade leaves are applied to bear a large area of window sash .
sentences.chinese: 採用高檔合頁，可承重大面積的窗扇。

definition: door/the opening panel of a door
variant of 百葉窗|百叶窗[bai3 ye4 chuang1]
floor/floor (ie. metal plate, concrete slab, wooden planking etc)
a building/the frame of a building/roof beam/truss
cord fabric used in vehicle tires
